descriptions.index: Detailed text tutorials for creating Minecraft mods with Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5
descriptions.java-basics: An overview of java programming language concepts required to create Minecraft mods.
descriptions.environment-setup: Setup a development environment to create a Minecraft mod with the Forge API (1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.basic-items: How to create a simple item in your Minecraft Forge mod (1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.advanced-items: How to create items with complex bevavior, like food and fuel (Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.basic-blocks: How to create a simple block in your Minecraft Forge Mod (1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.advanced-blocks: Create a block with complex behavior (like reacting to right clicks) in your Minecraft Forge Mod (1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.tools-armor: Create custom tools and armor in your Minecraft mod (Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.tile-entities: Create a block entity that stores data and reacts to ticks (Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.enchantments: Create a custom enchantment that builds a bridge as you walk (Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.recipes: Define recipes in the crafting table, furnace, smithing table, anvil, brewing stand and stone cutter
descriptions.arrows: Create a custom projectile that can be shot from a bow (Forge 1.18.1, 1.17.1 or 1.16.5)
descriptions.updating: A detailed tutorial on updating your Minecraft Forge mod from 1.16 to 1.17 to 1.18
descriptions.mappings: An in-depth explication of the code mappings system used for making Minecraft mods
descriptions.sides: An in-depth explication of the difference between the Client Side and the Server Side when making Minecraft mods
descriptions.registries: An in-depth explication of how Minecraft mods register game objects (like items, blocks, entities, etc)
descriptions.events: An in-depth explication of how the Forge Events System allows your Minecraft mod to react to actions taken in game
descriptions.dem-lobsters: Add integration with Dem Lobsters to your mod. Easily create a new lobster type that produces your modded resources.
